authors: Emily Crane For Daily Mail Australia
description: Former Canterbury Bulldogs player, Jacob Loko, was caught by police with five capsules of MDMA at Sydney's Star City Casino last October and pleaded guilty in court on Thursday.
title: NRL's Jacob Loko pleads guilty after being caught with five MDMA in Sydney
title_page: NRL's Jacob Loko pleads guilty after being caught with five MDMA in Sydney | Daily Mail Online
text:
Rugby league player Jacob Loko has been given an 18-month good behaviour bond after pleading guilty to possessing drugs.
The 23-year-old was caught with five capsules of MDMA at Sydney's Star City Casino last October.
Loko, a former Canterbury Bulldogs player, pleaded guilty to one charge of possessing a drug during a brief appearance at Downing Centre Local Court on Thursday.
Scroll down for video
Jacob Loko, a former Canterbury Bulldogs player, pleaded guilty to one charge of possessing a drug during a brief appearance at Downing Centre Local Court on Thursday
Police also arrested and charged another man, 22, at the time with supplying ecstasy.
The NRL club also launched an investigation alongside police at the time.
'Whilst contracted to the club until the end of the month, Loko has been told he would not have his contract renewed for 2016,' they said when he was charged.
The 23-year-old was caught with five capsules of MDMA at Sydney's Star City Casino last October
Loko never played first grade for the Bulldogs and hasn't played in the NRL since he played 23 games for the Parramatta Eels (pictured) in 2013
Loko last year pleaded guilty to high-range drink driving after returning a blood alcohol reading almost four times the legal limit.
He was also banned for four games last March after a drunken brawl Manly's Jorge Taufua outside a Sydney bar. He was fined $10,000 and was given 150 community hours.
Loko never played first grade for the Bulldogs and hasn't played in the NRL since he played 23 games for the Parramatta Eels in 2013.
